emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party, front row from left: Mrs. Earlee Thomas, bride Mary Frances Walker Stokes, groom Theodore E. Stokes, James Stokes, Joshua Walker; back row: Ruth Young, Shirley Butler, Richard Truman, Ollie Matthew, and Rev. Charles Foggie, posed in domestic interior with ornate mirror
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 19, 1946, pg. 9, reads: Charming Ceremony - In a charming double ring ceremony, Miss Mary Frances Walker and Theodore E. Stokes were married by the Rev. Charles Foggie, Monday night. in wedding party were Mrs. Earlee Thomas, matron of honor; the bride and groom; James Stokes, best man, and Joshua Walker, father of the bride.  Also shown, rear, left to right; Miss Ruth Young and Shirley Butler, bridesmaids, and Richard Truman, Ollie Matthew, groomsmen; the Rev. Charles Foggie. - Harris Photo."
